lines.text: You got a date with justice, One Eyed Bart.
Too bad, Sheriff! I'm a married man!
I think you dropped something, mister!
Give it up, Bart! You've reached the end of the line!
I always wanted to go out with a bang!
Hate to leave early, but our ride is here.
It's me or the kiddies, Sheriff! Take your pick!
Glad I could catch the train!
You can't touch me, Sheriff! I've brought my attack dog with a built-in force field! (whistles)
Well, I've brought my dinosaur, who eats force field dogs!
That's Mr. Evil Dr. Porkchop to you!
Buzz! Shoot your laser at my badge!
No, no, no! Just keep playing. Just pretend I'm not here.
No, it's okay, Mom. It's a fifty-foot baby from outer space! And she's on a rampage! Run for your lives!
Buster, get out of there! Does the red light mean it's going?
Come on, say happy birthday to Molly.
I came as fast as I could! Buzz, behind you!
Okay, places, everyone. (pushes something aside) Come on, come on. Get in position.
Wait. I can't find my other eye.
Alright, who's foot's in my face?
You have saved our lives. We are eternally grateful.
Buzz, mind if I squeeze in next to you?
Yes, no. I mean, (stammering) why would I mind squeezing next to you? (clears throat) Is it hot in here?
All right, guys. We got one shot at this. Everyone ready?
We're ready, Woody! Let's do it!
Just like we rehearsed it, guys.
Molly, stay out of my room!
Then who was messing with my stuff?
He held me! He actually held me!
Who are we kidding? The kid's 17 years old.
We ain't ever getting played with.
Uh, guys, hey, hold up. W-w-we need a staff meeting. Everyone! A staff meeting!
Okay. Uh, first off, we all knew Operation Playtime was a long shot.
But we always said this job isn't about getting play with, it's about...
Being there for Andy, we know.
But we can try again, right?
I'm callin' it, guys. We're closing up shop.
Andy's going to college any day now. That was our last shot.
We're going into attic mode, folks. Keep your accessories with you at all times. Spare parts, batteries, anything you need for an orderly transition.
Orderly?! Don't you get it?! We're done! Finished! Over the hill!
Hey, hey, hey, now. Come on, guys! We all knew this day was coming.
Hey, Sarge! What are you doing?
The war's over, folks. Me and the boys are moving on.
We've done our duty. Andy's grown up.
And let's face it. When the trash bags come out, we army guys are the first to go.
Who said anything about trash bags?
It has been an honor serving with you. Good luck, folks.
No, no, no. Wait, wait, wait, wait!
No! No one's getting thrown away!
I thought we were going to the attic.
Oh, I hate all of this uncertainty.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Hold on now. Wait a minute. Quiet! No one's getting thrown out, okay?! We're all still here! I mean, yeah, we've lost friends along the way. Wheezy and Etch and...

Yeah, even– even Bo. All good toys who've gone on to new owners. But through every yard sale, every spring cleaning, Andy held onto us. He must care for us or we won't be here. You wait. Andy's gonna tuck us in the attic. It'll be safe and warm...
Exactly! There's games up there, and books, and...
There you go! The old TV! And those guys from the Christmas decorations box. They're fun, right?
And someday, if we're lucky, Andy may have kids of his own.
And then he'll play with us then. Right?
We'll always be there for him.
Come on, guys. Let's get our parts together, get ready, and go out on a high note.
I'd better find my other eye.
Where'd you leave it this time?
Come on. Let's see how much we're going for on eBay.
Don't worry. Andy's gonna take care of us. I guarantee it!
I don't know, Buzz. What else could I say?
Well, whatever happens, at least we'll all be together.
Cause I'll be taking it with me.
Okay. Andy, let's get to work here. Anything you're not taking to college either goes in the attic, or it's trash.
Mom, I'm not leaving till Friday.
Look, it's simple. Skateboard, college. Little League trophy, probably attic. Apple core, trash. You can do the rest.
Why do you still have these toys?
Three more days and it's mine!
Molly, you're not off the hook, either. You have more toys than you know what to do with. Some of them could make other kids really happy.
The children at the daycare. They're always asking for donations.
No buts. You choose the toys you want to donate, I'll drop them off at Sunnyside.
ly, you're not off the hook, either. You have more toys than you know what to do with. Some of them could make other kids really happy.
The children at the daycare. They're always asking for donations.
No buts. You choose the toys you want to donate, I'll drop them off at Sunnyside.
Andy, come on. You need to start making decisions.
Like what are you gonna do with these toys? Should we donate them to Sunnyside?
Mom, no one's gonna want those old toys. They're junk.
Fine. You have till Friday. Anything that's not packed for college or in the attic is getting thrown out.
We're getting thrown out, you idiot! That's what happening!
Here. So, you gonna miss me when I'm gone?
If I say no, do I still get your room?
That's not trash! That's not trash! Think, think, Woody! Think, think, think! Oh! Buster! Come here, boy! Come here!
Okay, boy. To the curb! Hyah!
No, Buster! No! Get up. Buster!
Oh, I knew it would come to this!
Oh, forget it! It's triple-ply, high-density polyethylene!
There's gotta be a way out!
Oh, Andy doesn't want us! What's the point?
I can hear the garbage truck! It's getting closer!
I should have seen this coming. It's Emily all over again.
Wait a minute. Wait, hold on. This is no time to be hysterical.
It's the perfect time to be hysterical.
Yee-haw! Fellas, I know what to do.
Oh, we should have done this years ago.
He's fine, Buzz. Andy's taking him to college. Now we need to go!
What, what's going on? Don't you know this box is being donated?
It's under control, Woody. We have a plan.
Daycare?! What, have you all lost your marbles?!
Well, didn't you see?! Andy threw us away!
No! No, no, no, no, no, he was putting you in the attic!
Attic? Then how did we end up on the curb?
That was a mistake! Andy's mom thought you were trash!
Yeah. After he put us in a trash bag.
Uh, y-yeah, I know. It looks bad. But, guys, you gotta believe me.
Andy's moving on, Woody! It's time we did the same.
Okay. Out of the box. Everyone, right now! Come on, Buzz, give me a hand. We gotta get this thing outta here.
Woody, wait. We need to figure out what's best for everyone.
Oh, great. Great! It's gonna take us forever to get back here.
Oh, it's all right, Barbie. You'll be okay.
Well, Molly and I have been growing apart for years. It's just I can't believe she would throw me away!
Okay, everyone, listen up. We can get back to Andy's, but we gotta move fast. We'll hide under the seats till we get home.
Get it through your vinyl noggin, Woody! Andy doesn't want us anymore!
He was putting you... ...IN THE ATTIC!!!
HE LEFT US ON THE CURB!!!
Alright, calm down! Both of you!
Okay, fine! Fine! Just wait'll you see what daycare's like.
Daycare is a sad, lonely place for washed-up old toys who have no owners.
Oh, you'll see. As soon as we get to daycare, you'll be begging to go home.
So much for sad and lonely, huh?
Okay. Calm down, guys. Let's try to keep this in perspective.
Woody, it's nice. See? The door has a rainbow on it.
Wow! Haven't seen you in ages!
I just wanted to drop these old toys off. Is this Bonnie? Look how big you are!
How are your kids, Molly and Andy?
Not kids anymore. Andy's going to college on Friday.
Are you sure they won't miss having these?
Nah. They never get played with.
No, no, no. What's the matter with you?
So now what do we do?
We go back to Andy's. Anybody see an exit?
Exit schmexit. Let's get played with.
Careful. These toys might be jealous of new arrivals.
Well, howdy! Glad to meet ya!
Well, hello there. I thought I heard new voices. Welcome to Sunnyside, folks. I'm Lotso Hugging Bear. But please call me Lotso.
First thing you gotta know about me, I'm a hugger.
Oh, look at you all. You've been through a lot today, haven't ya?

Well, you're safe now. We're all castoffs here. We been dumped, donated, yard-saled, secondhanded and just plain thrown out. But just you wait, you'll find being donated was the best thing that ever happened to ya.
Mr. Lotso, do toys here get played with every day?
All day long. Five days a week.
But what happens when the kids grow up?

Well, now, I'II tell ya. When the kids get old, new ones come in. When they get old, new ones replace them. You'll never be outgrown or neglected, never abandoned or forgotten. No owners means no heartbreak.
And you want us to stay at Andy's.
So, you got donated by this Andy, huh? Well, it's his loss, Sheriff. He can't hurt you no more.
Now, let's get you all settled in. Ken? Where is that boy? Ken? New toys!
Far out! Down in a jiff, Lotso.
So, who's ready for Ken's dream tour?
Let's show our new friends where they'll be staying.
Uh, folks, if you want to step right this way...
Come on, Ken. Recess don't last forever.
Right on, Lotso. This way, everybody.
You got a lot to look forward to, folks. The little ones love new toys.
Folks, if I can share, here at Sunnyside, we've got, well, just about anything a toy could ask for.
Spare parts, superglue, and enough fresh batteries to choke a Hungry Hungry Hippo. Think you're gettin' old?
Our repair spa will keep you stuffed, puffed, and lightly buffed.
And this, well, this is where I live. It's Ken's Dream House. It has a disco, it's got a dune buggy. And a whole room just for trying on clothes.
Everything except someone to share it with.
You need anything at all, you just come to me. Here we are.
Why, thank you, Big Baby. Why don't you come meet our new friends?
Everything except someone to share it with.
You need anything at all, you just come to me. Here we are.
Why, thank you, Big Baby. Why don't you come meet our new friends? Poor baby. We were thrown out together, me and him. Abandoned by the same owner.
But we don't need owners at Sunnyside. We own ourselves. We're masters of our own fate. We control our own destines.
Oh. Watch out for puddles. And here's where you folks'll be stayin'. The Caterpillar Room.
What the, Oh. Hey there, little guy.
How long's it been since you all got played with?
that bell's gonna ring and you'll get the playtime that you've been dreamin' of.
Play! Real play! I can't wait!
Now, if you'll excuse us, we best be headin' back. Welcome to Sunnyside, folks.
Oh, I'll see you tonight. In my dreams.
Ken? Let's get a move on.
Barbie, come with me! Live in my dream house. I know it's crazy, I know we just met, heck, you don't know me from G.I. Joe but when I look at you I feel like we were...
Oh, I wanna get played with! Why can't time go faster?!
How many do you reckon are out there?
Look, everyone. It's nice here. I admit it. But we need to go home.
We can have a whole new life here, Woody. A chance to make kids happy again.

I have a kid. You have a kid. Andy! And if he wants us at college or in the attic, well, then, our job is to be there for him! Now I'm going home! And whoever wants to join me is welcome. (walking away) Come on, Buzz.
Our mission with Andy is complete, Woody.
And what's important now is we stay together.
We wouldn't even be together if it weren't for Andy. Look under your boot, Buzz. You too, Jessie. Whose name is written there?
Maybe Andy doesn't care about us anymore.
Of course he does. He cares about all of you! He was putting you in the attic; I saw him! You can't just turn your back on him now!
Woody! Wake up! It's over! Andy is all grown up!
Okay, fine. Perfect! I can't believe how selfish you all are!
So this is it? After all we've been through.
Bullseye, no. You need to stay.
Look, I don't want you left alone in the attic, okay? Now stay.
Come on. Come on. Oh, no, no.
There you are. Come on, honey. It's time to go home.
Oh, it's gonna be okay, Bullseye.
Woody's going to college with Andy. It's what he's always wanted.
Ah, he's crazy. College is no place for a toy.
Oh, speaking of play time, they're lining up out there!
At last! I'm gonna get played with!
There's a snake in my boot! I'd like to join you posse boys, but first I'm gonna sing a little song.
Move over, Mr. Pricklepants! We have a guest!
It's good for you but don't drink too much. Or you'll have to, have to, be right back!
Psst! Hey, hello? Hi. Excuse me.
Can you tell me where I am?
The guy just asked you a question.
Well, excuse me, but I'm trying to stay in character.
My name's Buttercup. You've met Baron Von Shush.
Guys, hey, guys, look, I don't know where I am.
We're either in a café in Paris or a coffee shop in New Jersey. I'm pretty sure I just came back from the doctor with life-changing news.
Look, we do a lot of improv here. Just stay loose, have fun, you'll be fine.
Bee-boop-bee-boop. It has a secret ingredient.
Who would do such a mean thing?
Argh! The scary witch! Look out!
She'll never find us in here.
She found us! We need a spaceship to get away from the witch!
Look, I just need to know how to get out of here!
Just kidding. The door's right over there.
Well, cowboy, you just jumped right in, didn't ya? I'm Dolly.
Woody? Really? You're gonna stick with that? ,Cause now's your chance to change it, new room and all. That's coming from a doll named Dolly.
Course he's not, pea brain! He doesn't even have a hat.
I do too have a ha...
Quick, get in. Fasten your seat belts. fold your tray tables. Hold on. It might get a little bumpy. Three, two, one, blastoff!
Yee-haw! You saved us cowboy, you're our hero!
Oh, I've got a kink in my slink.
Oh, I've got a kink in my slink.
Here it is. (giving her the arm Hamm tossed to them)
Give me that. That's mine. (after putting his eyes in)
I don't recall playtime being quite that strenuous.
Andy never played with us like that.
We're just gonna have to make the best of it.
But these toddlers, they don't know how to play with us.
We should be in the Butterfly Room.
We'll get this straightened out. I'll go talk to Lotso about moving us to the other room.
Negatory. It's a Fenster-Schneckler 380. Finest childproof lock in the world.
Wait! Did anyone notice the transom?
Oh, great. How do we get up there?
All right, everyone. On three! One, two...
You think they had a fun playtime?
See? That time I said love. Okay, now me first.
You. You see what I mean? It changes every time.
All right, place your bets. Come on, everybody. Come on. Any splits?
Here we go. Come on, horsey, come on!
Come on, turkey, come on, petting zoo!
All right, that's it. No more bets.
Let me have the duck, let me have the duck, let me have the duck!
Okay, minimum bet, five Monopoly. Coyote's wild.
Changing two double A's. Hey, what do you guys think of the new recruits? Any keepers?
But that space guy. He could be useful.
He ain't the sharpest knife in the place where they keep the knives.
You got a little keeper yourself, didn't you, Ken?
Hey, lay off, Twitch. Barbie's different.
What do you expect from a girl's toy?
I'm not a girl's toy! I'm not! Why do you guys keep saying that?
Ah, those toys are disposable. We'll be lucky if they last us a week.
Well, well. Look who we have here.
Psst. Woody, what are you doing?
But didn't you have fun today?
Well, of course I did, more than I've had in years, but, you see, I belong to someone else.
He's my Bonnie. And he's leaving soon. I gotta get home.
Elm Street. 234 Elm. You guys have a map?
Unhand me, you cowards! I demand to talk to Lotso!
Zip it, Buck Rogers. You don't talk to Lotso till we say you can...
Ken? What's goin' on here? Why is this toy tied up?
"Got out"? Oh, no, no, no, no, no. This isn't how we treat our guests. F-A-Oh, my Schwarz. There you go. I'm so sorry.
The children in the Caterpillar Room are not age-appropriate for me and my friends. We respectfully request a transfer to the Butterfly Room.
Hush now, Kenneth. This toy's shown initiative, leadership. Why, I'd say we've found ourselves a keeper. Hear that, everyone? We got a keeper!
We're calling you up to the big leagues, son. From now on, you'll have anything you want.
Excellent. I'll go get my friends.
Whoa, whoa. Hold on there, boss. Those Caterpillar kids need someone to play with.
But my friends don't belong there.
Oh, none of us do, l agree. Which is why, for the good of our community, we ask the never toys, the stronger ones, to take on the hardships the rest of us can't bear anymore.
Well, I-I guess that makes sense. But I can't accept. We're a family. We stay together.
Family man, huh? l understand. Put him back in the timeout chair.
Ah! Here it is. It was filed under "Lightyear."
Let's see here. "Accessories. Maintenance." Oh. Here we go. "Remove screws to access battery compartment."
Stop! Let go of me! Ow!
"To return your Buzz Lightyear action to its original factory settings..."
"...slide the switch from Play to Demo."
Sounds like it came from the hall.
No, just a dark hall and...
Wait. Wait! I see Andy! In his room!
My other eye! The one I left behind!
This is so weird. He's packing up.
Okay, Andy's out in the hall. He's looking in the attic. Wait, there's Mom.
Why is he so upset? [realizing] Oh, no! Oh, this is terrible!
He's looking for us! Andy's looking for us!
So, Andy does want us! I knew it! I just knew it!
I think he did mean to put us in the attic.
Well, then, Woody was telling the truth.
Hey, you didn't believe him first!
Guys, we gotta, we gotta go home!
Hey there. How are y'all doing this fine evening?
Thank goodness! Have you seen Buzz?
There's been a mistake. We have to go.
Go? Why, you just got here. In the nick of time, too. We were runnin' low on volunteers for the little ones. They just love new toys, now, don't they?
"Love"?! We've been chewed, kicked, drooled on!
Well, here's the thing, sweet potato. You ain't leaving Sunnyside.
“Sweet potato"?! Who do you think you're talking to?! I have over 30 accessories, and I deserve more respec—!
Hey, nobody takes my wife's mouth, except me!
Give it back, you furry air freshener!
Come on, guys. We're going home.
Whoa there, missy. You're not going anywhere.
Oh, yeah? And who's gonna stop us?
Silence, Minions of Zurg! You're in the custody of the Galactic Alliance!
Good work, Lightyear. Now, lock them up!
Where do you think you're going?
Spare me your lies, temptress! Your emperor's defeated, and I'm immune to your bewitching good looks.
Hey, Mongo! Keep your paws off my wife!
Hey! Let go of me, you drooling doofus!
Not him. I think this potato needs to learn himself some manners. Take him to the box.
Hey! Put me down, you moron! Where are you taking me? Bad baby! Bad baby!
Barbie! I told you to wait in the Dream House.
What are you doing to my friends?
And give me my scarf back!
Barbie! I told you to wait in the Dream House.
What are you doing to my friends?
And give me my scarf back!
Prisoners sleep in their cells. Any prisoner caught outside their cell spends the night in the box.
Roll call at dusk and dawn. Any prisoner misses roll call spends the night in the box. Prisoners do not speak unless spoken to. Any prisoner talks back spends the night—
In the box. We get it.
At ease, soldier. They're neutralized. But remember, they'll say anything to make you doubt yourself.
Don't worry, Commander. Any doubt I had got pounded out of me at the academy.

Listen up, folks. We got a way of doing things here at Sunnyside: If you start at the bottom, pay your dues, life here can be a dream come true! But if you break our rules, step outta line, try to check out early, well, you're just hurting yourselves.
Woody! What did you do to him?
You all get a good night's rest.
You got a full day of playtime tomorrow.
Oh! That's just a dinosaur toy down the street. That's nothing. Let me just take care of that. Just a dinosaur.
Please don't be far. Please. Please!
I'm going to college! Look at me! I'm a big toy on campus! Hello! Hey, I'll see you at the sock hop.
Hey, listen. If any of you guys ever get to Sunnyside Daycare, you tell them Woody made it home.
Well, it wasn't easy. I (suddenly stops) What do you mean "escape"?
Sunnyside is a place of ruin and despair, ruled by an evil bear who smells of strawberries.
The guy may seem plush and huggable on the outside, but inside, he's a monster.
But, how do you know that?
Yeah, I knew Lotso. He was a good toy. A friend. Me and him, we had the same kid, Daisy.
I was there when Lotso got unwrapped. Daisy loved us all. But Lotso, Lotso was special. They did everything together. You've never seen a kid and a toy more in love.
One day, we took a drive. Hit a rest stop. Had a little playtime. After lunch, Daisy fell asleep.
She never came back. Lotso wouldn't give up. It took forever, but we finally made it back to Daisy's.
But by then, it was too late.
Something changed that day inside Lotso. Something snapped.
She replaced all of us! Didn't she?!
She don't love you no more! Now come on!
We were lost. Cast off. Unloved. Unwanted.
Then we found Sunnyside. But Lotso wasn't my friend anymore.
He wasn't anyone's friend. (shows Big Baby's pendant to them) He took over Sunnyside and rigged the whole system.
I got broke. Bonnie found me, took me home. Other toys, they weren't so lucky. It ain't right what Lotso done. New toys, they don't stand a chance.
But my friends are in there.
Quiet, musical hog! Knock it off!
Oh, Bullseye. I miss Woody too. But he ain't ever coming back.
Excellent, Lightyear. Come on. We need ya back at Star Command.
Wait! What've you done with my husband?
It was cold and dark. Nothing but sand and a couple of Lincoln logs.
Uh, I don't think those were Lincoln logs.
You all get ready. You got a playdate with destiny!
You shouldn't have come back, cowboy. They've cracked down hard since you left. More guards, more patrols. You and your friends ain't ever gettin' out of here now.
You got lucky once. Want my advice? Keep your heads down. You'II survive.
I've been here years. They'II never break me. There's only one way toys leave this place.
Poor fella. Trash truck comes at dawn. Then it's off to the dump.
Look, I appreciate your concern, old-timer. But we have a kid waiting for us. Now, we're leaving. lf you'd help us, one toy to another, I'd sure be grateful.
Well, if you're gonna get out, first thing you gotta get through's the doors. Locked, every night. Inside and out. Keys are left on a hook in the office.
Lotso has trucks patrolling all night long. Hallway, lobby, playground.
Yeah, yeah, yeah. What about the wall?
Eight feet high. Cinder block. No way through it. You either go over or under.
That's it? Doesn't seem so bad.
It's not. Your real problem's the Monkey.
The Monkey's the eye in the sky. He sees everything. Classrooms.
You can unlock doors, sneak past guards, climb the wall, but if you don't take out that monkey, you ain't going nowhere. You wanna get outta here? (serious) Get rid of that monkey!
Hey, my hat! Wait, where's Buzz?
He thinks he's a real space ranger again.
Oh, yes. Return of the astro-nut.
Oh Woody We were wrong to leave Andy. I, I was wrong.
Jessie's right, Woody. She was wrong.
No, no, it was my fault for leaving you guys. From now on, we stay together.
College! Hogtie the mailman! We gotta get you home before Andy leaves tomorrow!
It means we're busting out of here. Tonight.
But, there's no way out of here!
No, there is one way out.
Okay, here's what we're gonna do.
Hey, hey! Tuberous root-man! Wake up!
A little late for a stroll, eh, Potato Head?
That's Mr. Potato Head to you, smoothie.
Well, well, well. You're turning out to be quite the troublemaker, aren't you? What did you think you were gonna do? Waltz right out of here?
Yeah, and I would've got away with it, too, if it weren't for you meddling toys! You ascot-wearing pink-noser! You're not a toy! You're an accessory! You're a purse with legs.
Ow! Take him back to the box!
No! No, not the box! I'm sorry. I didn't mean it! I like ascots. Really. No, no, noooooo!
Good work, Lightyear. All right, resume your, uh, space-guy-thingy.
I can't take it here, Ken. I wanna
Ow! Take him back to the box!
No! No, not the box! I'm sorry. I didn't mean it! I like ascots. Really. No, no, noooooo!
Good work, Lightyear. All right, resume your, uh, space-guy-thingy.
I can't take it here, Ken. I wanna go to the Butterfly Room. With you!
Yeah, well, you should've thought of that yesterday.
I was wrong. I wanna be with you, Ken, I do. In your Dream House. (sobbing) Please take me away from this! Take me away!
Darn it, Barbie! Okay, but things are complicated around here. You gotta do what I say.
Wait. I'll do anything! I'll-l'll change your diapers!
And this is where the magic happens.
Look at all your clothes! I can't believe you never brought me up here! Tennis whites? Mission to Mars!
I know, I know, I know. Check this out! Kung fu fighting. Campus hero with matching sports pennant, huh?
No one appreciates clothes here, Barbie. No one.
Ken, would you model a few outfits for me? Just a few?
Where is it, where is it? Where's the key? Where's the key? Bingo!
Hey! What do you think you're doing?! I told you! Keep your hands off of my stuff!
Hey, hey! No fighting! Break it up!
Take that, walnut-brain. No wonder you're extinct!
Hey, you can't hit each other! That's my job!
No more games, Ken! What did Lotso do to Buzz, and how do we switch him back?
You can't make me talk! You can't!
But I'd like to see you try.
Oh! Barbie, those were vintage! It's okay. All right, go ahead, rip 'em, I don't care. They're a dime a dozen.
Who cares? Who cares? Sequins are tacky. Who cares?
Oh, no, no, no! No!! There's an instruction manual! Lotso switched Buzz to Demo mode!
I don't know why this couldn't wait until morning, Ken, but...
So how do we fix Buzz?
What are you looking at, feathers?
Oh, give it up. No one can hear ya.
I said "no one can hear you".
Stop him! Don't let him get out!
Star Command, I've been taken hostage by my own prisoners!
Unhand me, Zurg scum! The Galactic Courts will show you no mercy!
It's not working. Why is it not working? Where's the manual?
Here we go! There should be a little hole under the switch.
"To reset your Buzz Lightyear, insert paperclip..."
All right, let's see. "Caution: Do not hold button for more than five seconds."
Bitácora espacial... Me he despertado del hiper-sueño en un planeta extraño. (Star Log... I've awakened from hypersleep on a strange planet.)
I just did what you told me!
Estoy rodeado por criaturas extrañas y desconozco sus intenciones. (I'm surrounded by alien creatures of unknown intent.)
¿Quién andá ahí? ¿Amigo? O enemigo? (Who goes there? Friend? Or foe?)
Me debo de haber estrellado y se me ha borrado la memoria. (I must have crash-landed and had my memory erased.) [kisses Woody on each cheek] ¿Han visto mi nave espacial? (Anyone seen my spaceship?)
Well, how do we do that?
I don't know. That part's in Spanish.
We don't have time for this. Come on, El Buzzo.
Mi nave? ¿La encontraste? ¡Excelente! (My spaceship? You know where it is? Excellent!)
Things got complicated. Where's Potato Head?
¡Mi florecilla del desierto! ¡Yo nunca había visto la verdadera belleza hasta esta noche! (My desert flower! I have never seen true beauty until this night!)
You would not believe what I've been through tonight!
I feel fresh. Healthy. It's terrible!
You've lost weight. And so tall.
Ah, you're a sight for detachable eyes.

¡Venga conmigo, señorita! ¡Le enseñaré las maravillas de la galaxia, y juntos con nuestro amor venceremos al mal! (Come with me! I will show you the wonders of the galaxy, and we shall vanquish all evil with our love!)
[grunting] Come on, Buzz. Give me a lift.
¡Buzz Lightyear al rescate! (Buzz Lightyear to the rescue!)
Oh, way to go, Buzz! Come on.
Yeah, Come on down. But not all at once.
I think he said "all at once."
No. No. No, no, no, no, no!
Almost there, guys. Slink, you think you can make it?
Well, I might be old, but I still got a spring in my step.
What are y'all doin'? Runnin' back to your kid? He don't want you no more.
Is it? Tell me this, Sheriff. If your kid loves you so much, why is he leaving? You think you're special, cowboy? You're a piece of plastic. You were made to be thrown away.
Now, we need toys in our Caterpillar Room and you need to avoid that truck. Why don't you come on back, join our family again?
This isn't a family! It's a prison! You're a liar and a bully! And I'd rather rot in this dumpster than join any family of yours!
Jessie's right! Authority should derive from the consent of the governed, not from the threat of force.
Barbie! Wait! Don't do this, Lotso!
She's a Barbie doll, Ken. There's a hundred million just like her.
Fine! Then why do you join her?!
Everyone, listen! Sunnyside could be cool and groovy if we treated each other fair! It's Lotso! He's made us into a pyramid, and he put himself on top!
I didn't throw you away. Your kid did! Ain't one kid ever loved a toy, really! Chew on that when you're at the dump!
I don't know what you're talking about.
Daisy? You used to do everything with her?
Yeah? Then she threw us out.
She replaced you! And if you couldn't have her, then no one could! You lied to Big Baby and you've been lying ever since!
[sees the nametag and is stunned with anger] Where'd you get that?
As much as any kid ever loved a toy!
(mocking) What, you want your mommy back?! She never loved you! Don't be such a baby!
This is what happens when you dummies try to think! We're all just trash, waitin' to be thrown away! That's all a toy is!
Hey! Stop it! Put me down you idiot! Aah!
No! No! Wait a minute! Big Baby, wait!
Can you hear me? Is everyone okay?
Of course not, you imbecile! We're doomed!
Everyone, go to Buzz. Come on. We all here? Slinky? Rex?
Oh, Buzz, you're back! You're back, you're back, you're back, you're back!
Yes, I'm back. Where have I been?
Woody! So where are we now?
In a garbage truck on the way to the dump!
We'll be okay if we stay togeth-
Don't worry, Slink! We'll get you down!
Uhh, you might wanna take a look at this.
Help! Help me. I'm stuck! Help, please! Help!
We're all in this together. Right, guys?
Woody, look! I can see daylight! We're gonna be okay!
(with an evil grin) Where's your kid now, Sheriff?!
You know all that bad stuff I said about Andy's attic? I take it all back.
Oh, darling. You were so brave.
Yeah. I'd like to loosen his stitchin'.
Forget it, Guys. He's not worth it.
Hey, buddy! You might wanna keep your mouth shut!
Come on, Woody. We gotta get you home.
Wait. What about you guys? I mean, maybe the attic's not such a great idea.
We'II be there for him. Together.
I just hope he hasn't left yet.
Wait a minute. Wait! I'll check.
We'll never get there in time!
Is that it, honey? You got everything?
Yeah. Just a few more boxes in my room.
That's enough. That's enough. That's enough!
Hey, Woody. Have fun at college.
Yeah, but not too much fun.
Woody, take good care of Andy.
He's a good kid. Tell him to get a haircut.
Sure thing. Jessie, you'll be okay in the attic?
Course I will. Besides, I know about Buzz's [whispering] Spanish Mode.
Honey, you want some food for the road?
I'll get something on the way.
You know where to find us, cowboy.
Did you say goodbye to Molly?
Mom, we've said goodbye like 10 times.
I know. It's just... (sniffles) I just wish that I could always be with you.
Hey, aren't you going to say goodbye to Buster?
Of course I am. [to Buster] Who's a good doggy? Who's a good doggy? I'm gonna miss you. I'm gonna miss you.
Good boy. He's telling you to go already.
Come on. Get the rest of your things.
Okay, Buster. Now don't let Molly near my stuff.
Hey, Mom. So, you really think I should donate these?
It's up to you, honey. Whatever you wanna do.
Don't go in there! The bakery is haunted!
Shh! Are you crazy?! You'll wake up all the ghosts! Look out! The ghosts are throwing pies!
Wow. Look at you. Well, I hear you're off to college.
So, what can we do for you?
Uh, I have some toys here.
So, you're Bonnie? I'm Andy. Someone told me you're really good with toys. These are mine, but I'm going away now, so I need someone really special to play with them.

This is Jessie, the roughest, toughest cowgirl in the whole West. She loves critters, but none more than her best pal, Bullseye. (makes horse noises) Yee-haw! Here. [gives it to Bonnie] This is Rex, the meanest, most terrifying dinosaur who ever lived! (roars) The Potato Heads. Mr. and Mrs. You gotta keep ‘em together, ‘cause they're madly in love. Now Slinky here is as loyal as any dog you could want. And Hamm, he'll keep your money safe, but he's also one of the most dastardly villains of all time, evil Dr. Pork Chop. These little dudes are from a strange alien world. Pizza Planet. And this (makes whooshing noises) is Buzz Lightyear, the coolest toy ever! Look, he can fly and shoot lasers! He's sworn to protect the galaxy from the evil Emperor Zurg.
Now, you gotta promise to take good care of these guys. They mean a lot to me.
Woody? What's he doing in there?
There's a snake in my boot!

Now, Woody, he's been my pal for as long as I can remember. He's brave, like a cowboy should be. And kind. And smart. But the thing that makes Woody special is he'll never give up on you. Ever. He'll be there for you, no matter what. You think you can take care of him for me?
Oh, no! Dr. Pork Chop's attacking the haunted bakery!
And we'll actually need the rocket.
They're getting away! Come on, Bullseye!
We need to get in the spaceship. The volcano is gonna erupt. Look! They're being attacked by a real dog!
You can eat my poisonous scones!
Mr. and Mrs. Potato Head are in trouble.
It's my friend Woody. Buzz, hurry! Get your extra turbo booster!
Look, Mommy. They're all playing together.
Come on. Let's get some lunch.
Oh, Buzz, you haven't even met Bonnie's toys yet. Hey, come here. You're gonna love 'em. Buzz, this is Dolly.
So I guess you could say Sunnyside is sunny once again! Hope to hear from you soon. We're all super excited about your new home, hugs and kisses to everyone. Awww.
That Barbie has some nice handwriting.
We got the cloak of darkness! Run, run!
My arms are never long enough!
I'll do it! This is it! This is it!
Well, it's official. You guys made the wall.
Golly bob howdy! Hey, that's me!
Well, it's official. You guys made the wall.
Golly bob howdy! Hey, that's me!
Yeah, she really got your smile.
I told you kids! Stay out of my butt!
But soft. What light through yonder window breaks?
Romeo, oh, Romeo. Where thor art thou, Romeo?
Yeah. Detached wing. Cosmetic damage. Nothing a little duct tape can't fix.
[nervous chuckle] I, uh, I don't know what came over me.
